column2: And what good would that do? said Fritz, the swineherd.
column3: And what good would that do? said Fritz, the swineherd.

column2: How shall I find the Baron Conrad to bear a message to him, when our Baron has been looking for him in vain for two days past?
column3: How shall I find the Baron Conrad to bear a message to him, when our Baron has been looking for him in vain for two days past?

column2: I will have nothing to do with it! said Fritz, and he got up from the wooden block whereon he was sitting and stumped out of the house.
column3: I will have nothing to do with it! said Fritz, and he got up from the wooden block whereon he was sitting and stumped out of the house.

column2: But, then, Katherine had heard him talk in that way before, and knew, in spite of his saying "no," that, sooner or later, he would do as she wished.
column3: But, then, Katherine had heard him talk in that way before, and knew, in spite of his saying "no," that, sooner or later, he would do as she wished.

column2: Presently, with a click, a little square wicket that pierced the door was opened, and a woman's face peered out through the iron bars.
column3: Presently, with a click, a little square wicket that pierced the door was opened, and a woman's face peered out through the iron bars.

column2: The one-eyed Hans whipped off his leathern cap.
column3: The one eyed Hans whipped off his leathern cap.

column2: Hans held up a necklace of blue and white beads that glistened like jewels in the sun, and from them hung a gorgeous filigree cross.
column3: Hans held up a necklace of blue and white beads that glistened like jewels in the sun, and from them hung a gorgeous filigree cross.

column2: The necklace, said the girl, in a frightened whisper.
column3: The necklace, said the girl, in a frightened whisper.

column2: It's thine, said he, "and now wilt thou not help me to a trade?"
column3: It's thine, said he, "and now wilt thou not help me to a trade?"

column2: He settled the cap more firmly upon his head, spat upon his hands, and once more stooping in the fireplace, gave a leap, and up the chimney he went with a rattle of loose mortar and a black trickle of soot.
column3: He settled the cap more firmly upon his head, spat upon his hands, and once more stooping in the fireplace, gave a leap, and up the chimney he went with a rattle of loose mortar and a black trickle of soot.

column2: By and by footsteps sounded outside the door.
column3: By and by footsteps sounded outside the door.

column2: Suddenly a shower of mortar came rattling down the chimney.
column3: Suddenly a shower of mortar came rattling down the chimney.

column2: Bang! the door was clapped to and away they scurried like a flock of frightened rabbits.
column3: Bang! the door was clapped to and away they scurried like a flock of frightened rabbits.
